Legal_Issue: Appropriateness of the RAD's application of the reasonableness standard in reviewing RPD decisions
Evidence_Assessment: Credibility of applicants' claim of fear of persecution in El Salvador
Decision_Outcome: RPD found applicants not credible; RAD initially upheld decision using incorrect standard
Burden_of_Proof: On applicants to establish a well-founded fear of persecution
Credibility_Factor: RPD found applicants not credible due to inconsistencies in testimony
Legal_Rule: RAD must apply correct legal standard, not judicial review standard, when reviewing RPD decisions
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness standard required; improper use of judicial review standard by RAD
Procedural_Issue: RAD applied incorrect legal standard in its review
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution in El Salvador due to political influence and reprisals after reporting car theft
Outcome_on_Merits: Not determined; case remanded for proper assessment
Decision_Maker: Refugee Appeal Division (RAD), Refugee Protection Division (RPD)
Review_Standard: Correct legal standard (reasonableness), not deferential judicial review
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Failure to apply correct standard constitutes procedural unfairness
Key_Evidence_Considered: Applicants' testimony regarding car theft and fear of retaliation
Legal_Framework: Canadian refugee determination system under IRPA
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged RAD's use of judicial review standard as legally erroneous
Court_Result: Federal Court referred matter back to RAD for redetermination
Legal_Rule_Source: Recent Federal Court precedents on standard of review
Defendant_Response: Not explicitly stated; implied adherence to procedural rules by RAD
Evidence_Type: Testimonial evidence, narrative account of events
Remedy_Requested: Redetermination by RAD under correct legal standard
Remedy_Sought: Quashing of RAD decision and referral back for reconsideration
Legal_Provision: Sections of IRPA governing RAD review powers
Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA sections related to RAD appeals and standard of review
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Persecution based on political opinion or membership in particular social group
Outcome_of_Review: Decision set aside, remitted for redetermination
Governing_Rule: Administrative law principles on standard of review in administrative tribunals
